page.title: 02Strongford House.
page.content: Mr.and Mrs.Massey have lived at Strongford House for about 12 to 15 years.The house was built in 1819.The land owned by Mr.and Mrs.Massey is 1 acre and 1 tenth in size. In the olden days they brought flint on barges up the River Trent.They weighed them in the corner of the garden and took them on a horse and cart up the road to the pottery industries.Mr.Massey said that if you dug there you would find a lot of flint balls.There is a well in one of the outbuildings.There used to be a pump and the water was pumped onto the garden. The house was built by the Duke of Sutherland as part of his Trentham estate. It was then lived in by the manager of Strongford Sewage Works until it was bought by Mr.and Mrs.Massey. It is very modern inside. The house has three bedrooms.
